title: Low X-height sans from vintage french poster
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pepermint_4339.jpg)

Hey...

Im searching for something similar to this one. A sans with low X-height and a bit extended. Any idéas??
author: Gregers

comments.content: Even if I hate saying that, you could try scaling [Gotham HTF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/overview) or [Proxima Nova MS](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova). Out-of-the-box options: [Room](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/glen-jan/room), [Nexa FFF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/font-fabric/nexa)

Cheers Ryuk

Yep, would hate to do that. However gotham seems to come close. Would like to find something with just a little bit more contrast in the way of Timmonium, but not that much contrast, and proportions like the sample. Maybe it does not exist and a custom type is required.

OK, I see. I'd noticed the more contrasted /E crossbar but I've decided to stay focused on this /M pointy centre vertex.  
May be considering [Knockout HTF](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/knockout/overview) is worth of interest even if you'd have to mainly rework /R leg and /M centre vertex. There's also [Enamelplate B](http://web.archive.org/web/20140825204149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/enamelplate/b).
